intro: Torenia dictyophora, commonly known as the velvetleaf torenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems, and the plant is known for its ability to thrive in moist, sunny environments. Torenia dictyophora is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive blooms and relatively easy care requirements.
